chapter.keywords: online king james holy bible, king james bible, bible todo list, words of Jesus, bible index, the authorised version, KJV, KJB, KJAV, AV

items.text: These are also proverbs of Solomon, which the men of Hezekiah king of Judah copied out.
items.plainText: These are also proverbs of Solomon, which the men of Hezekiah king of Judah copied out.

items.text: It is the glory of God to conceal a thing: but the honour of kings is to search out a matter.
items.plainText: It is the glory of God to conceal a thing: but the honour of kings is to search out a matter.

items.text: The heaven for height, and the earth for depth, and the heart of kings is unsearchable.
items.plainText: The heaven for height, and the earth for depth, and the heart of kings is unsearchable.

items.text: Take away the dross from the silver, and there shall come forth a vessel for the finer.
items.plainText: Take away the dross from the silver, and there shall come forth a vessel for the finer.

items.text: Take away the wicked from before the king, and his throne shall be established in righteousness.
items.plainText: Take away the wicked from before the king, and his throne shall be established in righteousness.

items.text: Put not forth thyself in the presence of the king, and stand not in the place of great men:
items.plainText: Put not forth thyself in the presence of the king, and stand not in the place of great men:

items.text: For better it is that it be said unto thee, Come up hither; than that thou shouldest be put lower in the presence of the prince whom thine eyes have seen.
items.plainText: For better it is that it be said unto thee, Come up hither; than that thou shouldest be put lower in the presence of the prince whom thine eyes have seen.

items.text: Go not forth hastily to strive, lest thou know not what to do in the end thereof, when thy neighbour hath put thee to shame.
items.plainText: Go not forth hastily to strive, lest thou know not what to do in the end thereof, when thy neighbour hath put thee to shame.

items.text: Debate thy cause with thy neighbour himself; and discover not a secret to another:
items.plainText: Debate thy cause with thy neighbour himself; and discover not a secret to another:

items.text: Lest he that heareth it put thee to shame, and thine infamy turn not away.
items.plainText: Lest he that heareth it put thee to shame, and thine infamy turn not away.

items.text: A word fitly spoken is like apples of gold in pictures of silver.
items.plainText: A word fitly spoken is like apples of gold in pictures of silver.

items.text: As an earring of gold, and an ornament of fine gold, so is a wise reprover upon an obedient ear.
items.plainText: As an earring of gold, and an ornament of fine gold, so is a wise reprover upon an obedient ear.

items.text: As the cold of snow in the time of harvest, so is a faithful messenger to them that send him: for he refresheth the soul of his masters.
items.plainText: As the cold of snow in the time of harvest, so is a faithful messenger to them that send him: for he refresheth the soul of his masters.

items.text: Whoso boasteth himself of a false gift is like clouds and wind without rain.
items.plainText: Whoso boasteth himself of a false gift is like clouds and wind without rain.

items.text: By long forbearing is a prince persuaded, and a soft tongue breaketh the bone.
items.plainText: By long forbearing is a prince persuaded, and a soft tongue breaketh the bone.

items.text: Hast thou found honey? eat so much as is sufficient for thee, lest thou be filled therewith, and vomit it.
items.plainText: Hast thou found honey? eat so much as is sufficient for thee, lest thou be filled therewith, and vomit it.

items.text: Withdraw thy foot from thy neighbour's house; lest he be weary of thee, and so hate thee.
items.plainText: Withdraw thy foot from thy neighbour's house; lest he be weary of thee, and so hate thee.

items.text: A man that beareth false witness against his neighbour is a maul, and a sword, and a sharp arrow.
items.plainText: A man that beareth false witness against his neighbour is a maul, and a sword, and a sharp arrow.

items.text: Confidence in an unfaithful man in time of trouble is like a broken tooth, and a foot out of joint.
items.plainText: Confidence in an unfaithful man in time of trouble is like a broken tooth, and a foot out of joint.

items.text: As he that taketh away a garment in cold weather, and as vinegar upon nitre, so is he that singeth songs to an heavy heart.
items.plainText: As he that taketh away a garment in cold weather, and as vinegar upon nitre, so is he that singeth songs to an heavy heart.

items.text: If thine enemy be hungry, give him bread to eat; and if he be thirsty, give him water to drink:
items.plainText: If thine enemy be hungry, give him bread to eat; and if he be thirsty, give him water to drink:

items.text: For thou shalt heap coals of fire upon his head, and the LORD shall reward thee.
items.plainText: For thou shalt heap coals of fire upon his head, and the LORD shall reward thee.

items.text: The north wind driveth away rain: so doth an angry countenance a backbiting tongue.
items.plainText: The north wind driveth away rain: so doth an angry countenance a backbiting tongue.

items.text: It is better to dwell in the corner of the housetop, than with a brawling woman and in a wide house.
items.plainText: It is better to dwell in the corner of the housetop, than with a brawling woman and in a wide house.

items.text: As cold waters to a thirsty soul, so is good news from a far country.
items.plainText: As cold waters to a thirsty soul, so is good news from a far country.

items.text: A righteous man falling down before the wicked is as a troubled fountain, and a corrupt spring.
items.plainText: A righteous man falling down before the wicked is as a troubled fountain, and a corrupt spring.

items.text: It is not good to eat much honey: so for men to search their own glory is not glory.
items.plainText: It is not good to eat much honey: so for men to search their own glory is not glory.

items.text: He that hath no rule over his own spirit is like a city that is broken down, and without walls.
items.plainText: He that hath no rule over his own spirit is like a city that is broken down, and without walls.
